info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 12 at 7:53AM MST until October 12 at 9:45AM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
FFWPSR
The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 945 AM MST.
* At 753 AM MST, the public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Public reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Phoenix, Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Tempe, Apache Junction, East Mesa, Freestone Park, Downtown Mesa, Fiesta Mall, Superstition Springs Mall, Mesa Riverview Mall, Tempe Marketplace, Arizona State University, Usery Mountain Park, Arizona Mills Mall, South Phoenix and Guadalupe.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Salt River and Bulldog Wash.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
